intro: Solidago asteroides, commonly known as the New England aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue to purple flowers that bloom in the late summer and early fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and natural habitats. Solidago asteroides plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
